column4: Ok, I installed kubuntu-desktop on my Ubuntu install and now don't want it
I did apt-get remove kubuntu-desktop with no avail
apt-get remove libqt3-mt
by the wy, in the future you should use aptitude instead of apt-get to install.  Then your command would have worked
probably not but I don't know.  Why don't you try 'dpkg-reconfigure gdm' and restart X, and then remove kde
try removing libqt3-mt, kde cannot function without libqt3-mt
insert an ``again'  in there somewhere :)
one thing at a time, take care of kde first
my real problem is that this is the first time I've actually used linux ;)
